text:
Eli Grba (August 9, 1934 – January 14, 2019) was an American Major League Baseball pitcher. He was born Chicago, Illinois. Grba played for the New York Yankees from 1959 to 1960 and Los Angeles Angels from 1961 to 1963. His major league career ended during the 1963 season when he was 28 years old.
Grba died on January 14, 2019 in Florence, Alabama from pancreatic cancer at the age of 84.
